info.title: Order Management
info.description: The Walmart Order Management APIs help Sellers to manage customer’s Sales Orders and to stay up-to-date on orders fulfillment, which orders to fulfill, and when to fulfill them.

post.description: Updates the status of order lines to Shipped and trigger the charge to the customer. The response to a successful call contains the order with the shipped line items.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

processMode.description: Optional. Use this parameter only to update tracking information after order is shipped. Use 'PARTIAL_UPDATE' as value. Here PARTIAL_UPDATE will indicate that post shipment tracking information needs to be updated

orderLine.description: Information about one order line shipment

lineNumber.description: The line number associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

intentToCancelOverride.description: Needs to be passed as true during shipping as an acknowledgment for orders which are intent to cancel by the customer

sellerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified Seller; gives Sellers the ability to print their own custom order ID on the return label; limit of 30 characters

orderLineStatus.description: Details about the Order Line status

amount.description: Always use '1'

shipDateTime.description: The date the package was shipped

otherCarrier.description: Other carrier name, When otherCarrier is used, trackingUrl must also be provided

carrier.description: The package shipment carrier. Valid entries are: UPS, USPS, FedEx, Airborne, OnTrac, DHL Ecommerce - US, LS (LaserShip), UDS (United Delivery Service), UPSMI (UPS Mail Innovations), FDX, PILOT, ESTES, SAIA, FDS Express, Seko Worldwide, HIT Delivery, FEDEXSP (FedEx SmartPost), RL Carriers, Metropolitan Warehouse & Delivery, China Post, YunExpress,Yellow Freight Sys, AIT Worldwide Logistics, Chukou1, Sendle, Landmark Global, Sunyou, Yanwen, 4PX, GLS, OSM Worldwide, FIRST MILE, AM Trucking, CEVA, India Post, SF Express, CNE, TForce Freight, AxleHire, LSO, Royal Mail, ABF Freight System, WanB, Roadrunner Freight, Meyer Distribution, AAA Cooper, Canada Post, Southeastern Freight Lines, Japan Post, Correos de Mexico, XPO Logistics.

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, OneDay, WhiteGlove, Value or Freight

trackingURL.description: The URL for tracking the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if the otherCarrier parameter is used

trackingInfo.description: List of information about the package shipment and tracking updates

name.description: The name for the person/place of return address

address1.description: The first line of the return address

address2.description: The second line of the return address

city.description: The city of the return address

state.description: The state of the return address

postalCode.description: The zip code of the return address

country.description: The country of the return address

dayPhone.description: Phone of the center where the package shipment is returned

emailId.description: Email of the center where the package shipment is returned

returnCenterAddress.description: Gives Sellers the ability to specify the RC center address during fulfillment; any returns created for the PO will always be returned to the RC address specified

items.description: Details about the Order Line status

orderLineStatuses.description: A list of status updates for that orderLine, including shipping status updates

items.description: Information about one order line shipment

orderLines.description: List of orderLines in the shipment

post.description: Refunds one or more order lines that have been shipped. The response to a successful call contains the order with the refunded line items

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

isFullRefund.description:
Specifies that a full Refund is required to be set as true to do a full refund including all the applicable charges like tax and shipping.
If full refund is set as false and full item price is entered in the charge amount field, applicable charges like tax and shipping will also be refunded to perform a full refund.
In case of request containing multiple order lines, all order lines should either be of full refund scenario or partial refund but not both. Allowed values are true and false.

chargeType.description: The charge type for line items can be one of the following: PRODUCT or SHIPPING For details, refer to 'Charge Types'

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is ItemPrice. If chargeType is PRODUCT and includes a chargeName as SubscriptionDiscount, these are subscription orders with a discount. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

chargeAmount.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

taxName.description: The name associated with the tax. Example: 'Sales Tax'

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

taxAmount.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

tax.description: Tax information for the charge, including taxName and taxAmount

charge.description: List of elements that make up a charge

items.description: Details about any partial refund on the order

application\/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<orderRefund xmlns="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders">
    <purchaseOrderId>2575193093772</purchaseOrderId>
    <orderLines>
        <orderLine>
            <lineNumber>1</lineNumber>
            <isFullRefund>false</isFullRefund>
            <refunds>
                <refund>
                    <refundComments>test test</refundComments>
                    <refundCharges>
                        <refundCharge>
                            <refundReason>DamagedItem</refundReason>
                            <charge>
                                <chargeType>PRODUCT</chargeType>
                                <chargeName>Item Price</chargeName>
                                <chargeAmount>
                                    <currency>USD</currency>
                                    <amount>-10.02</amount>
                                </chargeAmount>
                                <tax>
                                    <taxName>Item Price Tax</taxName>
                                    <taxAmount>
                                        <currency>USD</currency>
                                        <amount>-5.03</amount>
                                    </taxAmount>
                                </tax>
                            </charge>
                        </refundCharge>
                        <refundCharge>
                            <refundReason>TaxExemptCustomer</refundReason>
                            <charge>
                                <chargeType>SHIPPING</chargeType>
                                <chargeName>Shipping Price</chargeName>
                                <chargeAmount>
                                    <currency>USD</currency>
                                    <amount>-1.02</amount>
                                </chargeAmount>
                                <tax>
                                    <taxName>Shipping Tax</taxName>
                                    <taxAmount>
                                        <currency>USD</currency>
                                        <amount>-0.05</amount>
                                    </taxAmount>
                                </tax>
                            </charge>
                        </refundCharge>
                    </refundCharges>
                </refund>
            </refunds>
        </orderLine>
    </orderLines>
</orderRefund>

post.description: You can cancel one or more order lines. You must include a purchaseOrderId when cancelling an order line. The response to a successful call contains the order with the cancelled line items

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

orderLine.description: Information to update the orderLine with cancellation details

orderLineStatus.description: List of details about the cancellation status update

cancellationReason.description:
Reason for cancellation. Example: 'CUSTOMER_REQUESTED_SELLER_TO_CANCEL'.

Cancellation reason should not be "CUSTOMER_REQUESTED_SELLER_TO_CANCEL" for non intent to cancel orders'

amount.description: Always use '1'

items.description: List of details about the cancellation status update

orderLineStatuses.description: A list of statuses which should contain the new cancellation status

items.description: Information to update the orderLine with cancellation details

orderLines.description: A list of orderLines to be cancelled

post.description: You can use this API to acknowledge an entire order, including all of its order lines. The response to a successful call contains the acknowledged order.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

get.description:
Retrieves the details of all the orders for specified search criteria.

Only orders created in last 180 days and a maximum of 20000 orders can be fetched at a time. Attempting to download more than 20000 orders will return an error.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: A seller-provided Product ID

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: The customer order ID

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID. One customer may have multiple purchase orders.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of purchase order line. Valid statuses are: Created, Acknowledged, Shipped, Delivered and Cancelled.

parameters.name: createdStartDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created after this date. Default is current date - 7 days. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: createdEndDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created before this date. Default is current date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: fromExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date after this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: toExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date before this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: lastModifiedStartDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were modified after this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: lastModifiedEndDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were modified before this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: shipNodeType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of shipNode. Allowed values are SellerFulfilled(Default), WFSFulfilled and 3PLFulfilled.

parameters.name: shippingProgramType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of program. Allowed value is TWO_DAY.

parameters.name: replacementInfo
parameters.description: Provides additional attributes - originalCustomerOrderID, orderType - related to Replacement order, in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: orderType
parameters.description: Specifies if the order is a regular order or replacement order. Possible values are REGULAR or REPLACEMENT. Provided in response only if query parameter replacementInfo=true.

get.description:
Retrieves all the orders with line items that are in the "created" status, that is, these orders have been released from the Walmart Order Management System to the seller for processing. The released orders are the orders that are ready for a seller to fulfill.

Only orders created in last 180 days and a maximum of 20000 orders can be fetched at a time. Attempting to download more than 20000 orders will return an error.

parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created after this date. Default is current date - 7 days. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: createdEndDate

isFullRefund.description:
Specifies that a full Refund is required to be set as true to do a full refund including all the applicable charges like tax and shipping.
If full refund is set as false and full item price is entered in the charge amount field, applicable charges like tax and shipping will also be refunded to perform a full refund.
In case of request containing multiple order lines, all order lines should either be of full refund scenario or partial refund but not both. Allowed values are true and false.
